result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Soto

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Jesus Soto appeared by phone.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared by phone for Jesus Soto.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received. Offer received. Atty. Risseeuw request plea/sentencing hearing date

ADDRESS INFO for Jesus Soto
Current: 112 East Mill Street, Plymouth, WI 53073 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2022)
Prior: 2932 Kohler Memorial Drive, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No violent or abusive contact with the party named in the bail bond.

4:03 PM Defendant Jesus Soto appeared by phone.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared by phone for Jesus Soto.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Def. motion to modify bond - request to remove the no-contact order with victim's residence and GPS requirement. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim 1 makes statement to the Court. State does not take a position. Court grants motion to modify bond.
Day Report dated 9-26-22
Scheduling conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Jesus Soto appeared by phone.  Attorney Glenn Gaskill for Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared by phone for Jesus Soto.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received. Offer received but Atty. Gaskill advised that Atty. Risseeuw was in a car accident and in the hospital, request additional Scheduling Hearing. Defense filed a Bail Bond Motion to Modify bail Conditions.  Bail bond hearing set for 10/3 at 4:00.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
defense

POSTED
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly at the victim's residence/property. 
No violent or abusive contact with the victim.
Comply with day reporting requirements; GPS monitoring-3 block radius from victim's residence.

11:11 AM Defendant Jesus Soto in court. Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Jesus Soto. Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court rcvd day report. 
Court reviews motion to modify bond filed by Defense. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim 1 present & makes a statement to the Court. 
Defense requests that the no-contact order be lifted.
State objects to any modification of bond.
Court modifies bond to allow no violent or abusive contact but keeps the GPS condition. 
Future dates previously set.
Day Report Dated: 08/18/22
Bail/bond hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.
defense

12:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesus Soto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by video for Jesus Soto. 
Given complaint-Advised of Rights-Bond set-NG plea entered-probable cause found-new address given. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim makes statement re: bond.
